intro: Hieracium laevigatum subsp. linguans, commonly known as the smooth hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often bluish-green in color. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and it produces small, oval-shaped achenes as its fruit. This subspecies is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
